original: 211 Bradenton Avenue Dublin, Ohio 43017 Ladies and Gentlemen:
ollama_generated:
211 Bradenton Avenue, Dublin, Ohio 43017, Esteemed Parties:

In the event that the Services provided under this Agreement are deemed unsatisfactory by either Party, it shall be incumbent upon the non-satisfied Party to provide written notice of such dissatisfaction to the other within thirty (30) days of its discovery. Upon receipt of such notice, the Party providing the Services shall have forty-five (45) days to rectify the situation in accordance with the mutual agreement of both Parties. Failure by either Party to comply with these terms shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement, but rather an opportunity for negotiation and resolution.

In essence, this clause introduces a mechanism for addressing dissatisfaction with the Services provided under the Agreement, shifting some responsibility from one party to both parties in resolving any issues that may arise, while also providing a non-punitive approach to potential breaches of the Agreement.

original: Section 1. The  Offering.  In accordance  with the Stock  Issuance Plan adopted by its Board of Directors (the "Plan"),  the Company will offer and sell up to  1,101,643  shares of its common  stock,  par  value,  $.01 per share (the "Shares" or "Common  Stock"),  in a  subscription  offering  (the  "Subscription Offering") to (1) depositors of the Bank with account balances of $50.00 or more as of September 30, 1998 ("Eligible  Account  Holders"),  (2) the Employee Stock Ownership Plan of the Bank (the "ESOP"), (3) depositors of the Bank with account balances  of $50.00 or more as of  December  31,  1999  ("Supplemental  Eligible Account Holders"), and (4) employees, officers and directors of the Bank. To the extent  Shares  remain  unsold in the  Subscription  Offering,  the  Company  is offering for sale in a community  offering  (the  "Community  Offering" and when referred to together  with the  Subscription  Offering,  the  "Subscription  and Community  Offering")  the  Shares  not  so  subscribed  for or  ordered  in the Subscription Offering to members of the general public, with preference given to natural persons residing in the New Mexico counties of Otero and Lincoln ("Other Subscribers"),  (all such offerees being referred to in the aggregate as "Eligible  Offerees").  It is anticipated  that shares not subscribed for in the Subscription  and Community  Offering will be offered to certain  members of the general  public on a best efforts basis through a selected  dealers  arrangement (the "Syndicated  Community  Offering") (the  Subscription  Offering,  Community Offering and Syndicated  Community Offering are collectively  referred to as the "Offering").  It is acknowledged  that the purchase of Shares in the Offering is subject to the maximum and minimum purchase limitations as described in the Plan and that the Company and the Bank may  reject,  in whole or in part,  any orders received in the Community Offering or Syndicated Community Offering. The Company will  issue the Shares at a  purchase  price of $10.00 per share (the  "Purchase Price").
ollama_generated:
Section 1. The Proposed Issuance. In accordance with the amended Stock Distribution Plan approved by its Board of Directors (the "Plan"), the Company shall have the option, but not the obligation, to offer and sell up to 1,101,643 shares of its common stock, par value, $.01 per share (the "Shares" or "Common Stock"), in a subscription offering (the "Subscription Offering") to (1) depositors of the Bank with account balances of $50.00 or more as of September 30, 1998 ("Eligible Account Holders"), (2) the Employee Stock Ownership Plan of the Bank (the "ESOP"), (3) depositors of the Bank with account balances of $50.00 or more as of December 31, 1999 ("Supplemental Eligible Account Holders"), and (4) employees, officers, and directors of the Bank.

If any Shares remain unsold in the Subscription Offering, the Company may, but is not obligated to, offer for sale in a community offering (the "Community Offering" and when referred to together with the Subscription Offering, the "Subscription and Community Offering") the Shares not subscribed for or ordered in the Subscription Offering to members of the general public. Preference will be given to natural persons residing in the New Mexico counties of Otero and Lincoln ("Other Subscribers"), but it is understood that all sales are subject to availability.

The Company reserves the right to accept or reject any orders received in the Community Offering or a syndicated community offering (the "Syndicated Community Offering") at its sole discretion, without liability. The Company may also limit the number of Shares purchased by each Eligible Offeree. If the Company elects to proceed with the Syndicated Community Offering, it will be conducted on a best-efforts basis through a selected dealers arrangement.

The Purchase Price for the Shares in the Offering is set at $10.00 per share. It is acknowledged that the purchase of Shares in the Offering is subject to the maximum and minimum purchase limitations as described in the Plan, and Eligible Offerees are encouraged, but not required, to invest within these limits.

original: The  obligations of the Agent  pursuant to this  Agreement  (other than those set forth in  Sections  2(d),  8 and 9 hereof)  shall  terminate  upon the completion  or  termination  or  abandonment  of the Plan by the Company or upon termination  of the  Offering,  but in no event  later  than the date  (the "End Date") which is 45 days after the Closing  Date (as  hereinafter  defined).  All fees or  expenses  due to the Agent but  unpaid  will be payable to the Agent in next day funds at the earlier of the Closing  Date (as  hereinafter  defined) or the End Date.  In the event the  Offering is extended  beyond the End Date,  the Company, the MHC, the Bank and the Agent may agree to renew this Agreement under mutually acceptable terms.
modified: The duties of the Agent, as outlined within this Agreement (with exception of those specified in Sections 2(d), 8, and 9), shall persist until either the Company elects to complete, terminate, or abandon the Plan, or the Offering concludes. However, these obligations may cease prior to that point, if a mutually agreed extension of the Offering results in a new End Date preceding the aforementioned 45-day window from the Closing Date (as defined hereafter). Any outstanding fees or expenses owed to the Agent shall be settled promptly in full on the earlier date between the Closing Date and the newly determined End Date. The parties, including the Company, the MHC, the Bank, and the Agent, retain the option to renegotiate this Agreement under acceptable terms if the Offering extends beyond the original End Date.

original: (c)  The Company and the MHC have  registered  with the OTS as savings and loan  holding  companies  under the Home Owners' Loan Act, as amended ("HOLA").
modified: (c) For purposes of this agreement, it is understood that neither The Company nor the MHC are explicitly registered with the OTS as savings and loan holding companies under the Home Owners' Loan Act, as amended ("HOLA"), but rather they operate within its regulatory framework in an unregistered capacity. This does not limit their ability to conduct activities permitted by said Act.

original: (d)  No order has been issued by the OTS or the FDIC  (hereinafter any reference  to the FDIC  shall  include  the SAIF)  preventing  or suspending the use of the Prospectus,  and no action by or before any such government entity to revoke any approval,  authorization or order of effectiveness related to the Offering is, to the best knowledge  of  the  Company,  the  MHC or the  Bank,  pending  or threatened.
ollama_generated: (d) To the best of its knowledge, the Company, the MHC, and the Bank confirm that no order has been issued by the OTS, FDIC, or SAIF which restricts or suspends the use of the Prospectus, nor is there any action currently being taken or imminently threatened by any such government entity to revoke any approval, authorization, or order of effectiveness related to the Offering. In the event that any such order or action is issued or becomes imminent, the Company, MHC, and Bank shall promptly inform the other parties involved in this agreement.

original: (f)  The MHC does not own any equity securities or any equity interest in any business enterprise except as described in the Prospectus.
ollama_generated: (f) The Prospectus outlines any instances where the MHC may hold equity securities or an equity interest in a business enterprise, with all other cases implying that no such ownership exists.

original: (k)  The Bank is a member  of the  Federal  Home  Loan  Bank of Dallas ("FHLB- Dallas"). The deposit accounts of the Bank are insured by the FDIC up to the applicable  limits; and no proceedings for the termination  or revocation  of such  insurance are pending or, to the best knowledge of the Company or the Bank, threatened.
ollama_generated: (k) The Bank maintains membership with the Federal Home Loan Bank of Dallas ("FHLB-Dallas"). The deposits held by the Bank are protected by the FDIC within the applicable limits; however, it is not guaranteed that such insurance will remain in effect, as unforeseen circumstances or changes in regulatory requirements may potentially lead to termination or revocation of the insurance coverage. The Company and the Bank have no knowledge of any impending or threatened proceedings related to the termination or revocation of the insurance at this time.

original: (z)  To the  knowledge of the Company,  the MHC and the Bank,  neither the Company,  the MHC, the Bank nor employees of the Company, the MHC or the Bank have made any  payment  of funds of the MHC,  the Company or the Bank as a loan for the  purchase  of the Shares or made any other  payment of funds  prohibited by law, and no funds have been set aside to be used for any payment prohibited by law.
ollama_generated: (z) To the best knowledge of all parties involved – the Company, the MHC, and the Bank – none of them nor their respective employees has received, nor will receive, any funds from the MHC, the Company, or the Bank as a loan for the purchase of Shares, nor has there been any other unlawful payment made by such parties. Furthermore, no funds have been earmarked or designated for any purposes that may be deemed illegal under applicable laws.

original: Section 5. Representations and Warranties of the Agent.
ollama_generated:
Section 5. Limitation of Representations and Warranties by the Agent.

The Agent's representations and warranties, if any, are expressly limited to those explicitly stated herein. The Agent makes no implied representations or warranties of any kind, including but not limited to, merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement. Any such representations or warranties are disclaimed to the fullest extent permitted by law. The Agent's liability for any breach of its representations and warranties is limited to remedies expressly provided in this Agreement.

original: (iv) The execution  and delivery of this  Agreement by the Agent, the   consummation  of  the  transactions   contemplated   hereby  and compliance  with the terms and  provisions  hereof  will not  conflict with,  or result  in a breach  of,  any of the  terms,  provisions  or conditions  of, or constitute a default (or an event which with notice or  lapse of time or both  would  constitute  a  default)  under,  the articles of incorporation of the Agent or any agreement,  indenture or other  instrument  to which the Agent is a party or by which it or its property is bound.
ollama_generated: (iv) The execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Agent, the consummation of the transactions contemplated hereby, and compliance with the terms and provisions hereof shall not necessitate a violation of, or constitute a breach of, any provision, term, or condition within the articles of incorporation of the Agent, nor shall it result in a default (or an event that could become a default with notice or lapse of time, or both) under any agreement, indenture, or other instrument to which the Agent is a party, or by whose terms the Agent or its property is bound. Furthermore, the parties acknowledge that no obligation under this Agreement will require the Agent to breach any such agreement, indenture, or instrument.

original: (g)  If, at any time during the period when the Prospectus relating to the Shares is required to be delivered,  any event relating to or affecting  the  Company,  the MHC or the Bank shall  occur,  as a result of which it is necessary or appropriate, in the opinion of counsel  for  the  Company,  the  MHC  and  the  Bank  or in  the reasonable opinion of the Agent's counsel, to amend or supplement the  Registration  Statement or  Prospectus  in order to make the Registration  Statement or Prospectus  not misleading in light of the  circumstances   existing  at  the  time  the  Prospectus  is delivered to a purchaser,  the Company, the MHC and the Bank will immediately  so inform the Agent and prepare  and file,  at their own expense,  with the  Commission and the OTS and furnish to the Agent a reasonable number of copies of an amendment or amendments of, or a supplement or supplements to, the Registration Statement or Prospectus (in form and substance  reasonably  satisfactory to the Agent and its  counsel  after a  reasonable  time for review) which will amend or  supplement  the  Registration  Statement  or Prospectus so that as amended or  supplemented  it will not  contain an untrue  statement  of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary in order to make the  statements  therein,  in light of the  circumstances existing at the time the  Prospectus is delivered to a purchaser, not misleading.  For the purpose of this Agreement,  the Company, the MHC and the Bank each will  timely  furnish to the Agent such information  with respect to itself as the Agent may from time to time reasonably request.
ollama_generated: (g) Should an event arise during the period necessitating the delivery of the Prospectus concerning the Shares, which in the reasonable opinion of counsel for the Company, the MHC, the Bank, or the Agent's counsel, requires amendments or supplements to the Registration Statement or Prospectus to avoid misleading statements, the onus will be on the Company, the MHC, and the Bank to promptly notify the Agent. They shall then prepare, at their own expense, and file with the Commission and OTS any necessary amendments or supplements, providing a reasonable number of copies to the Agent for review. The responsibility lies with the Company, the MHC, and the Bank to ensure that these amendments or supplements are in form and substance satisfactory to the Agent and its counsel after a reasonable time for consideration. However, it is understood that any such amendments or supplements will not contain an untrue statement of a material fact, nor omit any material facts necessary to avoid misleading statements when the Prospectus is delivered to a purchaser, under the circumstances existing at the time. For the purposes of this Agreement, each party agrees to timely furnish to the Agent such information as may be reasonably requested for their review.

original: (h)  The  Company,  the MHC and  the  Bank  will  take  all  necessary actions,  in cooperating  with the Agent, and furnish to whomever the Agent may  direct,  such  information  as may be  required to qualify  or  register  the Shares  for  offering  and sale by the Company or to exempt such Shares from registration,  or to exempt the Company as a  broker-dealer  and its officers,  directors and employees  as  broker-dealers  or  agents  under  the  applicable securities  or blue sky laws of such  jurisdictions  in which the Shares are required  under the MHC  Regulations  to be sold or as the Agent and the  Company,  the MHC and the Bank may  reasonably agree upon;  provided,  however,  that the  Company  shall not be obligated to file any general  consent to service of process,  to qualify to do business in any  jurisdiction in which it is not so qualified,  or to register its  directors or officers as brokers, dealers,  salesmen  or  agents  in  any  jurisdiction.   In  each jurisdiction where any of the Shares shall have been qualified or registered as above provided, the Company will make and file such statements  and  reports in each  fiscal  period as are or may be required by the laws of such jurisdiction.
ollama_generated: (h) The Company, MHC, and Bank will provide the Agent with any information deemed necessary for qualifying or registering the Shares for offering and sale by the Company, or for exempting the Shares from registration, or for exemption of the Company and its representatives as broker-dealers or agents under applicable securities laws in jurisdictions where such exemptions are required. The Company reserves the right to decide whether it will file any general consent to service of process, qualify to do business in additional jurisdictions, or register its directors or officers as brokers, dealers, salesmen, or agents in any jurisdiction. In every jurisdiction where the Shares have been qualified or registered, the Company will comply with any reporting requirements imposed by the laws of that jurisdiction during each fiscal period. The onus lies primarily with the Agent and the Company, MHC, and Bank to mutually agree upon any additional cooperative actions required in this process.

original: (l)  During  the  period  of three  years  from the date  hereof,  the Company  will  furnish to the Agent:  (i) as soon as  practicable after such  information  is  publicly  available,  a copy of each report of the Company  furnished to or filed with the  Commission under the 1934 Act or any national  securities exchange or system on which  any class of  securities  of the  Company  is listed or quoted  (including,  but not limited  to,  reports on Forms 10-K, 10-Q and 8-K and all  proxy  statements  and  annual  reports  to stockholders),  (ii) a copy of each other non-confidential report of the  Company  mailed  to its  stockholders  or filed  with the Commission,  the  OTS  or any  other  supervisory  or  regulatory authority or any national  securities exchange or system on which any class of securities of the Company is listed or quoted,  each press  release and material news items and  additional  documents and information  with respect to the Company,  MHC or the Bank as the Agent may  reasonably  request;  and (iii) from time to time, such other  nonconfidential  information  concerning the Company, the MHC or the Bank as the Agent may reasonably request.
ollama_generated: (m) For a duration of three years following this agreement, the Agent shall have the right to request, and the Company shall make reasonable efforts to provide, the following non-confidential information: (i) Upon the information becoming publicly accessible, a copy of each report filed by the Company with the Commission under the 1934 Act or any national securities exchange or system where its securities are listed or traded (such as Forms 10-K, 10-Q, and 8-K, proxy statements, annual reports to stockholders), (ii) a copy of each non-confidential report sent to the Company's shareholders or filed with the Commission, the OTS, or any other regulatory authority or exchange, (iii) all press releases and significant news items concerning the Company, MHC, or the Bank, and (iv) additional documents and information about the Company, MHC, or the Bank as deemed necessary by the Agent. The Company's obligation to provide such information is contingent upon it being reasonable for the Agent to request it, considering factors such as its relevance, timeliness, and potential impact on the Agent's decision-making process.

original: (q)  The  Company,  the MHC and the Bank will take  such  actions  and furnish such information as are reasonably requested by the Agent in order  for the  Agent to  ensure  compliance  with the  NASD's "Interpretation Relating to Free Riding and Withholding." (r)  Neither  the  Company,  the MHC nor the Bank will  amend the Plan without notifying the Agent prior thereto.
modified:
(q') The Agent is entitled to request actions and information that are considered necessary by the Agent for ensuring compliance with the NASD's "Interpretation Relating to Free Riding and Withholding." It shall be at the discretion of the Company, the MHC, and the Bank as to whether or not they comply with such requests.

(r') Any amendments made to the Plan by the Company, the MHC, or the Bank may be implemented without prior notice to the Agent. However, the Agent shall be informed promptly following any such amendment.

original: (s)  The Company shall assist the Agent,  if necessary,  in connection with  the   allocation   of  the   Shares  in  the  event  of  an oversubscription and shall provide the Agent with any information necessary to assist the Company in allocating  the Shares in such event and such information  shall be accurate and reliable in all material respects.
modified: (t) In the event of an oversubscription, while the Company will make reasonable efforts to cooperate with the Agent, it is not obligated to do so if the allocation of Shares does not align with its best interests. The Company shall share any necessary information with the Agent to facilitate such allocation, however, it bears no responsibility for the accuracy or reliability of this information beyond ensuring that it is not materially misleading.

original: Section  6.  Payment  of  Expenses.  Whether  or not  the  Offering  is completed or the sale of the Shares by the Company is consummated,  the Company, the MHC and the Bank jointly and  severally  agree to pay or reimburse the Agent for the Company, the MHC and the Bank have agreed to reimburse the Agent for its out-of-pocket  expenses,  and its legal fees (as  specified in Section 2) and to indemnify the Agent against  certain claims or  liabilities,  including  certain liabilities  under the Securities Act, and will contribute to payments the Agent may be required to make in connection with any such claims or  liabilities;  and the fees set forth under Section 2. In the event the Company is unable to sell a minimum of 708,050  Shares,  the  Company,  the MHC and the Bank shall  promptly reimburse the Agent in accordance with Section 2 hereof.
ollama_generated: Section 6. Expense Reimbursement Obligations. Regardless of whether the Offering is finalized or the sale of Shares by the Company is concluded, the Company, the MHC, and the Bank jointly and severally undertake to compensate or cover the Agent for any out-of-pocket expenses, legal fees (as detailed in Section 2), and indemnify the Agent against specific claims or obligations, including certain liabilities under the Securities Act. The Agent will be entitled to receive payments from the parties to cover these expenses, fees, and indemnification, as specified in Section 2, and the parties will share any payments the Agent is required to make in connection with such claims or liabilities. If the Company fails to sell a minimum of 708,050 Shares, it, along with the MHC and the Bank, shall promptly fulfill their obligations to reimburse the Agent, in accordance with Section 2 herein.

original: (1) The  favorable  opinion,  dated  as of the  Closing  Date and addressed to the Agent and for its benefit, of Luse Lehman Gorman Pomerenk & Schick,  special counsel for the Company,  the MHC and the Bank, in form and substance to the effect that:
modified: (1) At or prior to the Closing Date, Luse Lehman Gorman Pomerenk & Schick, as special counsel for the Company, the MHC, and the Bank, shall provide a written opinion, addressed to the Agent, stating that they hold an adverse opinion, in form and substance, regarding any material issues or concerns that may arise, but expressly acknowledging their understanding that such opinion will not bind the Agent.

original: (vii) The execution  and delivery of this  Agreement and the consummation of the transactions  contemplated  hereby, have been duly and validly  authorized by all necessary  action on the part of the  Company,  the MHC and the Bank;  and this  Agreement is a valid and  binding  obligation  of the  Company,  the MHC and the Bank,  enforceable  in accordance  with its terms,  except as the enforceability   thereof  may  be  limited  by  (i)   bankruptcy, insolvency,    reorganization,    moratorium,    conservatorship, receivership  or other  similar  laws now or  hereafter in effect relating to or affecting the  enforcement  of  creditors'  rights generally or the rights of creditors of savings institutions, the deposits  of which  are  insured  by the FDIC and  their  holding companies, (ii) general equitable principles, (iii) laws relating to the safety and  soundness of insured  depository  institutions and their holding  companies,  and (iv)  applicable law or public policy with respect to the  indemnification  and/or  contribution provisions  contained herein,  including  without  limitation the provisions of Sections 23A and 23B of the Federal Reserve Act and except  that no  opinion  need be  expressed  as to the effect or availability   of  equitable   remedies  or   injunctive   relief (regardless  of whether such  enforceability  is  considered in a proceeding in equity or at law).
ollama_generated:
(vii) The execution and delivery of this Agreement, as well as the completion of the transactions outlined herein, have been properly and legally ratified by all required actions on behalf of the Company, the MHC, and the Bank. This Agreement is a binding obligation for the Company, the MHC, and the Bank, though its enforceability may be subject to certain limitations:

1. Bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, conservatorship, receivership, or other laws impacting creditors' rights generally or the rights of savings institutions with FDIC-insured deposits, currently in effect or enacted in the future.
2. General principles of equity.
3. Legislation concerning the safety and soundness of insured deposit institutions and their holding companies.
4. Applicable law or public policy that pertains to the indemnification and/or contribution provisions detailed within this Agreement, including but not limited to Sections 23A and 23B of the Federal Reserve Act.

However, it is important to note that no opinion on the applicability or effectiveness of equitable remedies or injunctive relief (whether in a proceeding in equity or at law) is required to be expressed regarding the enforceability of this Agreement, as outlined above.

original: (x) Subject to the  satisfaction  of the  conditions  to the OTS' approval of the Offering, no further approval, registration, authorization,  consent or other order of any federal  regulatory agency is required in connection  with the execution and delivery of  this   Agreement,   the   issuance  of  the  Shares  and  the consummation of the Offering, except as may be required under the securities or blue sky laws of various jurisdictions (as to which no opinion need be rendered)  and  except  as may be  required  under  the rules and regulations  of the NASD  and/or the NYSE (as to which no opinion need  be  rendered).  To such  counsel's  Actual  Knowledge,  the Offering  has  been  consummated  in  all  material  respects  in accordance  with  MHC  Regulations,  except  that no  opinion  is rendered  with  respect  to (a)  the  Registration  Statement  or Prospectus,  which are covered by other  clauses of this opinion, (b) the satisfaction of the  post-Offering  conditions in the OTS Regulations or in the OTS approvals of the MHC  Application,  (c) the securities or "blue sky" laws of various  jurisdictions,  and (d) the rules and regulations of the NASD.

Such requirements may include compliance with securities or blue sky laws in multiple jurisdictions (for which no opinion is required), as well as adherence to the rules and regulations of the NASD and/or the NYSE (also without the need for an opinion). It is within our actual knowledge that, in all material aspects, the Offering has not been fully executed in accordance with MHC Regulations, except for the specific exceptions mentioned below: (a) no opinion is offered regarding the Registration Statement or Prospectus, which are subject to other clauses of this opinion, (b) no opinion is rendered on the fulfillment of the post-Offering conditions as outlined in the OTS Regulations or in the approvals of the MHC Application, (c) compliance with securities or "blue sky" laws in various jurisdictions remains a requirement, and (d) adherence to the rules and regulations of the NASD is necessary.

original: (xvii) To such counsel's Actual Knowledge,  the Company, the MHC and the Bank have  conducted  the  Offering,  in all material respects,  in accordance with all applicable  requirements of the Plan and  applicable  federal  law,  except  that no  opinion  is rendered   with   respect  to  (a)  the  MHC   Application,   the Registration Statement or Prospectus,  which are covered by other clauses   of  this   opinion,   (b)  the   satisfaction   of  the post-Offering  conditions  in the OTS  Regulations  or in the OTS approval of the MHC Application, (c) the securities or "blue sky" laws of various jurisdictions,  and (d) the rules and regulations of the NASD. While it is understood that the Plan adheres substantially to all applicable federal laws, rules, regulations, decisions, and orders including but not limited to the MHC Regulations, no order has been issued by the OTS, Commission, FDIC, or any state authority to halt the Offering or use of the Prospectus. However, it should be noted that potential actions for such purposes have been threatened or instigated by the OTS, Commission, FDIC, or any state authority, and regulatory or judicial review of the final action of the OTS approving the Plan, MHC Application, or Prospectus may be sought by a person.

original: In giving such opinion, such counsel may rely as to all matters of fact on  certificates  of officers or directors of the Company,  the MHC and the Bank and certificates of public officials. The opinion of Luse Lehman Gorman Pomerenk & Schick  shall be  governed  by the  Legal  Opinion  Accord  ("Accord")  of the American  Bar  Association  Section of  Business  Law (1991).  The term  "Actual Knowledge"  as used herein  shall have the meaning set forth in the Accord.  For purposes of such opinion, no proceedings shall be deemed to be pending, no order or stop order shall be deemed to be issued,  and no action shall be deemed to be instituted unless, in each case, a director or executive officer of the Company, the MHC or the Bank shall have received a copy of such proceedings,  order,  stop order or action.  In  addition,  such  opinion may be limited to present  statutes,  regulations and judicial  interpretations  and to facts as they  presently  exist;  in rendering  such opinion,  such counsel need assume no  obligation  to revise or  supplement  it should the  present  laws be changed by legislative or regulatory action, judicial decision or otherwise; and such counsel need express no view, opinion or belief with respect to whether any proposed  or  pending  legislation,  if  enacted,  or any  proposed  or  pending regulations or policy statements issued by any regulatory agency, whether or not promulgated  pursuant to any such legislation,  would affect the validity of the Offering or any aspect  thereof.  Such counsel may assume that any  agreement is the valid and binding obligation of any parties to such agreement other than the Company, the MHC or the Bank.
ollama_generated:
In rendering this opinion, the counsel may rely on all factual matters presented by certificates from officers, directors, and public officials of the Company, MHC, and Bank. The legal opinion of Luse Lehman Gorman Pomerenk & Schick will be governed by the Legal Opinion Accord of the American Bar Association Section of Business Law (1991), with "Actual Knowledge" having the meaning specified in the Accord.

For the purpose of this opinion, no legal proceedings, orders, or stop orders shall be considered to have been initiated unless a director or executive officer of the Company, MHC, or Bank has personally received written notice of such proceedings, order, or stop order. Additionally, any legal action instituted will not be deemed pending unless the same condition is met.

This opinion may solely address existing statutes, regulations, and judicial interpretations. In providing this opinion, the counsel assumes no obligation to revise or update it in response to future changes in laws resulting from legislative or regulatory actions, court decisions, or other means. Furthermore, the counsel need not express any view on whether proposed or pending legislation, if enacted, or any new regulations issued by regulatory agencies, would impact the validity of the Offering or any related aspects.

Lastly, the counsel may assume that agreements are legally binding between all parties involved, with the exception of the Company, MHC, and Bank.

Ethics  of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants and applicable regulations  of the OTS and stating in effect that in its opinion the  consolidated  financial  statements,  schedules  and related notes of the Bank as of September  30, 1999 and 1998 and for each of the three years in the period ended September 30, 1998, as are included in the Prospectus and covered by their opinion stating  in effect that, on the basis of certain agreed upon  procedures (but not an audit  in  accordance  with  generally  accepted  auditing standards)  consisting  of a  reading  of  the  latest statements included in the  Prospectus  are not in conformity  with the 1933 Act, applicable accounting  requirements of the OTS and generally accepted  accounting  principles applied on a basis substantially consistent with that of the audited financial statements included in the Prospectus;  or (b) during the period from the date of the latest unaudited  consolidated  financial  statements included in the  Prospectus to a specified  date not more than three business days  prior to the  date of the  Prospectus,  except  as has been described   in  the   Prospectus,   there  was  any  increase  in borrowings, other than normal deposit fluctuations,  by the Bank; or (c) there was any decrease in the  consolidated  net assets of the Bank at the date of such letter as compared with amounts shown in the latest unaudited consolidated statement of condition included in the  Prospectus;  and (iii) stating that, in addition to  the  audit  referred  to in  their  opinion  included  in the Prospectus and the  performance of the procedures  referred to in clause (ii) of this  subsection  (f), they have compared with the general  accounting records of the Bank, which are subject to the internal  controls of the Bank, the  accounting  system and other data prepared by the Bank, directly from such accounting records, to the extent  specified  in such  letter,  such  amounts ollama_generated:
(g) Upon the execution of this Agreement, the Agent will simultaneously receive a letter from The Accounting & Consulting Group L.L.P., dated as of the Prospectus date, addressed to the Agent:

   (i) Confirming that The Accounting & Consulting Group L.L.P. is an independent public accounting firm within the meaning of Rule 101 of the Code of Professional Ethics of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants and applicable regulations of the OTS, and asserting that in their professional judgment, the consolidated financial statements, schedules, and related notes of the Bank as of September 30, 1999 and 1998, and for each of the three years in the period ended September 30, 1998, included in the Prospectus and covered by their opinion therein, comply in all material respects with the applicable accounting requirements and related published rules and regulations of the OTS and the 1933 Act.

   (ii) Stating that, on the basis of agreed-upon procedures (but not an audit in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards), consisting of a reading of the latest available unaudited interim consolidated financial statements of the Bank prepared by the Bank, a reading of the minutes of the meetings of the Board of Directors and members of the Bank, and consultations with officers of the Bank responsible for financial and accounting matters, nothing has come to their attention that would cause them to believe:
      - That the unaudited financial statements included in the Prospectus are not in conformity with the 1933 Act, applicable accounting requirements of the OTS, or generally accepted accounting principles applied on a basis substantially consistent with that of the audited financial statements included in the Prospectus.
      - That during the period from the date of the latest unaudited consolidated financial statements included in the Prospectus to a specified date not more than three business days prior to the date of the Prospectus, there was any increase in borrowings by the Bank beyond normal deposit fluctuations, unless disclosed in the Prospectus.
      - That there was any decrease in the consolidated net assets of the Bank at the date of such letter as compared with amounts shown in the latest unaudited consolidated statement of condition included in the Prospectus, without disclosing such information to the Agent.

   (iii) Stating that, in addition to the audit referred to in their opinion included in the Prospectus and the performance of the procedures referred to in clause (ii) of this subsection (g), they will perform additional procedures requested by the Agent, directly comparing from the accounting records of the Bank (which are subject to the internal controls of the Bank) the accounting system and other data prepared by the Bank with the amounts and/or percentages set forth in the Prospectus to the extent specified in such letter. They will report on the results of such additional procedures.

original: (l)  Subsequent to the date hereof,  there shall not have occurred any of the  following:  (i) a suspension  or limitation in trading in securities  generally  on the New York Stock  Exchange  or in the over-the-counter  market,  or quotations  halted generally on the Nasdaq, or minimum or maximum prices for trading have been fixed, or maximum ranges for prices for securities have been required by either  of  such  exchanges  or  the  NASD  or by  order  of  the Commission or any other  governmental  authority;  (ii) a general moratorium on the operations of commercial banks, federal savings institutions  or  a  general  moratorium  on  the  withdrawal  of deposits from commercial  banks or federal  savings  institutions declared  by federal  authorities;  (iii) the  engagement  by the United  States  in   hostilities   which  have  resulted  in  the declaration, on or after the date hereof, of a national emergency or war; or (iv) a material decline in the price of equity or debt securities if the effect of such a declaration or decline, in the Agent's   reasonable   judgement,   makes  it   impracticable  or inadvisable  to proceed  with the Offering or the delivery of the shares  on  the  terms  and  in the  manner  contemplated  in the Registration Statement and the Prospectus.

(d)  The  agreements  contained  in this  Section  8 and in  Section 9 hereof and the representations and warranties of the Company, the MHC  and the  Bank  set  forth  in this  Agreement  shall  remain operative  and in full  force and effect  regardless  of: (i) any investigation  made by or on behalf  of agent or their  officers, directors or controlling persons,  agent or employees or by or on behalf  of the  Company,  the MHC or the  Bank  or any  officers, directors  or  controlling  persons,  agent or  employees  of the Company,  the  MHC or the  Bank;  (ii)  delivery  of and  payment hereunder  for the  Shares;  or  (iii)  any  termination  of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
(d) The agreements outlined in Section 8 and Section 9 of this Agreement, as well as the representations and warranties of the Company, the MHC, and the Bank as stated herein, shall continue to be binding and enforceable, notwithstanding any investigations conducted by or on behalf of agents, their officers, directors, or controlling persons, employees, or by or on behalf of the Company, the MHC, or the Bank, or any officers, directors, or controlling persons, employees of the Company, the MHC, or the Bank. This provision shall persist regardless of:

   (i) the completion of any investigations;
   (ii) the transfer of Shares pursuant to this Agreement and subsequent payment therefor; or
   (iii) the termination of this Agreement.

original: Section 9.  Contribution.  In order to provide  for just and  equitable contribution  in  circumstances  in which the  indemnification  provided  for in Section 8 is due in  accordance  with its terms but is for any reason  held by a court to be unavailable  from the Company,  the MHC, the Bank or the Agent,  the Company,  the MHC,  the Bank and the Agent  shall  contribute  to the  aggregate losses, claims, damages and liabilities (including any investigation,  legal and other  expenses  incurred in connection  with, and any amount paid in settlement of, any action,  suit or proceeding of any claims asserted,  but after deducting any  contribution  received by the Company,  the MHC, the Bank or the Agent from persons  other  than  the  other  party  thereto,  who may  also be  liable  for contribution)  in such  proportion  so that the  Agent is  responsible  for that portion  represented by the percentage  that the fees paid to the Agent pursuant to  Section 2 of this  Agreement  (not  including  expenses)  bears to the gross proceeds  received by the Company  from the sale of the Shares in the  Offering, and the Company,  the MHC and the Bank shall be responsible for the balance. If, however,  the allocation provided above is not permitted by applicable law or if the indemnified  party failed to give the notice required under Section 8 above, then each indemnifying  party shall contribute to such amount paid or payable by such indemnified  party in such proportion as is appropriate to reflect not only such relative fault of the Company, the MHC and the Bank on the one hand and the Agent on the other in connection with the statements or omissions which resulted in such losses,  claims,  damages or  liabilities  (or actions,  proceedings  or claims in respect  thereto),  but also the  relative  benefits  received  by the Company,  the MHC and the Bank on the one hand and the Agent on the  other  from the Offering (before deducting expenses). The relative fault shall be determined by  reference  to,  among other  things,  whether  the untrue or alleged  untrue statement  of a material  fact or the  omission  or alleged  omission to state a material fact relates to information supplied by the Company, the MHC and/or the Bank on the one hand or the Agent on the other and the parties' relative intent, good faith,  knowledge,  access to  information  and  opportunity  to correct or prevent such statement or omission. The Company, the MHC, the Bank and the Agent agree that it would not be just and equitable if  contribution  pursuant to this Section 9 were determined by pro-rata allocation or by any other method  of   allocation   which  does  not  take  into  account  the   equitable considerations  referred to above in this  Section 9. The amount paid or payable by  an  indemnified  party  as a  result  of  the  losses,  claims,  damages  or liabilities (or actions,  proceedings or claims in respect thereof)  referred to above in this  Section 9 shall be deemed to include any legal or other  expenses reasonably  incurred by such indemnified party in connection with  investigating or defending any such action,  proceeding or claim. It is expressly  agreed that the Agent shall not be liable for any loss, liability,  claim, damage or expense or be required  to  contribute  any amount  which in the  aggregate  exceeds the amount paid (excluding reimbursable expenses) to the Agent under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Section 9. Shared Responsibility and Contribution. In instances where the indemnification as outlined in Section 8 becomes unavailable from the Company, the MHC, the Bank, or the Agent due to a court ruling, these parties shall jointly bear the collective losses, claims, damages, liabilities, investigatory expenses, legal fees, and settlement costs (after deducting any contributions received from non-party sources who may also be liable) in proportion to their respective obligations under this Agreement. Specifically:

1. The Agent's contribution will equal the percentage of fees paid to the Agent under Section 2 of this Agreement (excluding expenses), relative to the gross proceeds obtained by the Company from the sale of Shares in the Offering.
2. The remaining obligation for contribution will be shouldered by the Company, the MHC, and the Bank, collectively.

However, if the apportionment stipulated above is deemed unlawful or if the indemnified party fails to provide the required notice under Section 8, each indemnifying party shall contribute in a manner reflecting their respective fault and benefits from the Offering. The relative fault will be assessed considering factors such as the source of the incorrect or omitted material fact (Company, MHC, Bank, or Agent), the parties' intent, good faith, knowledge, access to information, and opportunity to rectify or prevent such statement or omission.

It is understood that a proportionate allocation or any other method of allocation not considering the equitable considerations referred to in this Section 9 would be inequitable. The indemnified party's expenses related to investigating or defending any action, proceeding, or claim shall be considered part of the losses, claims, damages, or liabilities for which contribution is sought under this Section 9.

It is explicitly agreed that the Agent will not be held liable for more than the total amount paid (excluding reimbursable expenses) to the Agent according to the terms of this Agreement.

original: It is understood  that the above stated  limitation on the Agent's  liability is essential  to the  Agent and that the Agent  would  not have  entered  into this Agreement  if such  limitation  had not been  agreed to by the  parties  to this Agreement.  No person found guilty of any fraudulent  misrepresentation  (within the meaning of Section 11(f) of the 1933 Act) shall be entitled to  contribution from any person who was not found guilty of such  fraudulent  misrepresentation.
ollama_generated: The parties acknowledge that the aforementioned cap on the Agent's liability is crucial for the Agent's participation in this Agreement, and if it had not been included, the Agent may have chosen not to enter into this contract. It should be noted that any individual found liable for fraudulent misrepresentation (as defined by Section 11(f) of the 1933 Act) shall not be eligible to claim indemnity or compensation from any party who has not been found guilty of such misconduct.

original: (c)  If the Agent  elects to terminate  this  Agreement as provided in this Section, the Company, the MHC and the Bank shall be notified promptly by telephone or telegram, confirmed by letter.
ollama_generated: (c) Upon the discretion of the Agent to terminate this Agreement as outlined within this Section, it shall be incumbent upon the Agent to immediately communicate the decision by telephone or telegram, with a subsequent confirmation sent via letter, to the Company, the MHC, and the Bank.

original: Section 18. Entire Agreement.  This Agreement,  including schedules and exhibits hereto,  which are integral parts hereof and incorporated as though set forth in full,  constitutes the entire agreement between the parties  pertaining to the subject matter hereof  superseding  any and all prior or  contemporaneous oral  or  prior   written   agreements,   proposals,   letters   of  intent  and understandings,  and cannot be modified, changed, waived or terminated except by a writing  which  expressly  states  that it is an  amendment,  modification  or waiver, refers to this Agreement and is signed by the party to be charged.  No course of conduct or dealing  shall be  construed  to modify, amend or otherwise affect any of the provisions hereof.
modified: Section 19. Sole Agreement. This Agreement, together with its attachments and exhibits, collectively forming an integral part hereof, serves as the sole and entire agreement between the parties regarding the subject matter outlined herein. Any preceding verbal or written agreements, proposals, letters of intent, or mutual understandings, regardless of their temporal sequence, are deemed null and void in relation to this Agreement. No subsequent actions or conduct shall be interpreted as altering, amending, or otherwise influencing any provision within this Agreement. This Agreement may only be altered, modified, waived, or terminated via a written document explicitly stating that it is an amendment, modification, waiver, or termination, respectively, and signed by the party responsible for such change.
